channel.title: Writing on Baki Cakici
channel.description: Recent content in Writing on Baki Cakici

item.title: Configuring Parents as Citizens and Consumers: Local Variations in Informational Material about School Allocation and Choice in Sweden
item.description: Children and their families in Sweden might encounter different understandings of education depending on which municipality they live in.

item.title: Spaceships and Poetry: Enlivening the Lab as a Site of Feminist Critical Pedagogy
item.description: We analyse the critical potential of STS lab work in technical environments and provide recommendations from our evolving space of feminist praxis.

item.title: The Politics of Seamlessness: A Rights Claims Perspective on Digital Identification Technologies
item.description: We analyse seamlessness and political participation as digital identification becomes the invisible background of state-citizen interactions.

item.title: When Numbers Run Out: Civil Registration and the Performativity of Methods
item.description: Personal identification numbers used in the Nordic countries contain a fundamental tension that is impossible to resolve via technical fixes.

item.title: Risken är att att 500 miljoner kronor kastas bort på en ny folkräkning
item.description: Mot bakgrund av kunskapsläget är vi förvånade över att regeringen och Sverigedemokraterna avser att driva igenom att Sverige ska genomföra en folkräkning.

item.title: Writing Bodies and Bodies of Text: Thinking Vulnerability Through Monsters
item.description: We suggest approaching writing as a vulnerable practice marked by an unstable boundary between bodies: bodies of text and bodies of writers.

item.title: Data Practices: Making Up a European People
item.description: The book develops a conception of data practices to analyze findings from collaborative ethnographic multisite fieldwork as part of a five-year project.

item.title: Data Subjects: Calibrating and Sieving
item.description: Who are the subjects of data practices? How do data practices configure the capacities of subjects to become part of a population?

item.title: Statistician Subjects: Differentiating and Defending
item.description: We consider how the statistician subject is being shaped, and the profession of national statistician repositioned, through professionalising practices.

item.title: Upon Not Opening The Black Box
item.description: We offer a discussion on the value of data, its use and non-use, as well as how to live with this ambivalence.

item.title: Methods as Forces of Subjectivation: Experiments in the Remaking of Official Statistics
item.description: We develop the concept of methods as forces of subjectivation in relation to experiments we have encountered in a study of official population statistics.

item.title: Peopling Europe through Data Practices: Introduction to the Special Issue
item.description: What does it mean to say, I am European? Where does Europe begin and end? Who can legitimately claim to be a part of a European people?

item.title: Doing a Transversal Method: Developing an Ethics of Care in a Collaborative Research Project
item.description: We depart from some conceptual presuppositions of methodological cosmopolitanism to define a transversal method.

item.title: Beyond Mystery: Putting Algorithmic Accountability in Context
item.description: We cannot stop at denouncing the lack of accountability for algorithms but must engage the broader systems and that algorithmic systems exist within.

item.title: Citizen Data and Trust in Official Statistics
item.description: In a time of alternative facts, what constitutes legitimate knowledge and expertise are major political sites of contention and struggle.

item.title: Data Scientists: A New Faction of the Transnational Field of Statistics
item.description: We discuss how data science as a field and a profession came into being in relation to but also as a critique of existing ones such as statistics and statisticians.

item.title: Regarding the Constants of Nature and of Art
item.description: Babbage’s constants and engines exemplified a rationality which emphasised counting and measurement as essential means for legitimate knowledge production.

item.title: Triggering Action: Participatory Surveillance and Event Detection in Public Emergency Management
item.description: Our chapter is informed by work that theorizes the relationship between knowledge of populations and modes of governance.

item.title: Citizen Data and Official Statistics: Background Document to a Collaborative Workshop
item.description: This working paper was written in preparation for a collaborative workshop organised for statisticians, social scientists, and app designers.

item.title: Transcending Methodological Nationalism Through a Transversal Method? On the Stakes and Challenges of Collaboration
item.description: This paper reflects on the challenges of doing collaborative ethnography in a research project (ARITHMUS) that studies the enactment of populations through statistics.

item.title: Changing Behaviour to Save Energy: ICT-Based Surveillance for a Low-Carbon Economy in the Seventh Framework Programme
item.description: EU FP7 texts discuss only the potential positive effects of technological surveillance, but neither acknowledge nor require the handling of its negative effects.

item.title: ICT4S 2029: What Will Be the Systems Supporting Sustainability in 15 Years?
item.description: What is your vision for systems that will be supporting sustainability in 15 years?

item.title: Detecting the Visible: The Discursive Construction of Health Threats in a Syndromic Surveillance System Design
item.description: Information and communication technologies are not value-neutral tools that reflect reality; they privilege some forms of action, and they limit others.

item.title: The Informed Gaze: On the Implications of ICT-Based Surveillance
item.description: Information and communication technologies are not value-neutral.

item.title: Sustainability Through Surveillance: ICT Discourses in Design Documents
item.description: Surveillance translates the traces, and the translations exert new pressures on existing power relations.

item.title: A Workflow for Software Development Within Computational Epidemiology
item.description: A critical investigation into computational models developed for studying the spread of communicable disease is presented.

item.title: Disease Surveillance Systems
item.description: This thesis presents a method for understanding disease surveillance systems structurally and examines four existing systems.

item.title: CASE: A Framework for Computer Supported Outbreak Detection
item.description: We present a technical framework designed and implemented at the Swedish Institute for Infectious Disease Control for computer supported outbreak detection.

item.title: Economic consequences to society of pandemic H1N1 influenza 2009 — preliminary results for Sweden
item.description: Experiments using a microsimulation platform show that vaccination against pandemic H1N1 influenza is highly cost-effective.

item.title: MicroSim: Modeling the Swedish Population
item.description: This article presents a spatially explicit microsimulation model that uses official anonymized register data collected from all individuals living in Sweden.

item.title: Pickman’s Machine: A Reasoning Architecture
item.description: A two-layered architecture for reasoning that uses narratives to guide its behavior is presented.
